job_title: Administrative Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great place to build a network - hours are manageable and holidays off are nice. A decent amount of interdepartmental collaboration.
cons: Pay could be better and could be more organized overall

review_title: Great professors, mixed bag of leadership
job_title: Assistant Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Fantastic liberal arts professors, cultural activities, library, community engagement, guest speakers, and chairs and deans in the Petree College of Arts and Sciences
cons: The music deans and some folks in administration can be too corporate and treat great faculty like workhorses. When leaders don't have a vision for the college - only their little slice of it within their major - It creates a school of silos/fiefdoms with no unified campus culture and no sense of common purpose among the faculty.

job_title: Coordinator in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Small department. Primary focus is recruitment and community music lessons
cons: Not as many perks as a public university, especially monetarily

job_title: Student Worker in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Relaxed environment, opportunities to study, secure job
cons: Occasionally tense or odd work environment, inconsistent management styles, passive aggression

job_title: Assistant Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Friendly staff, faculty, and students
cons: Low pay, old buildings, bad IT

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The college does help cover insurance and contributes to my 401k
cons: They don't give raises - EVER!

job_title: Work Study Student in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: the administration is great, fun environment
cons: small pay, compared to other schools we get paid significantly less for the same position

job_title: Web Services Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Benefits are really great, particularly time off. Some of the departments are staffed with really fantastic people.
cons: The university seems determined to do everything but pay its employees well.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: small enrollment and good programs
cons: aged professors and too many staff members

job_title: Assistant Professor in New York, NY
pros: got an office which was good
cons: they basically don't pay you

job_title: Associate Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Amazing faculty and staff, I love who I work with. We get great students and produce quality work.
cons: Low stagnant salaries. I've only received 2 small raises in 7 years. Facilities in much need of repair.

job_title: Patrol Officer in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
In theory, the university offers an incredible amount of "holiday" time which you can bank to use at another time, should your department require your presence during that time. 

The department works very hard to make sure its officers have the best equipment available. I was never in want of quality equipment. 

Actual hourly compensation is fairly competitive for this particular line of work.
cons:
In reality, the police department stays understaffed and disgruntled so you are often unable to use those holiday hours banked and will have to do some serious finagling to convince the school to pay you for the time you were unable to use. 

In the same breath, the department is also known to spend superfluously, purchasing unnecessary equipment or obscene amounts of expensive equipment in relation to the type of work being done in university policing and/or the size of their department. 

Little to no room for professional growth, even in a lateral sense. Unable/Unwilling to invest the time/energy in utilizing individual strengths to benefit the department as a whole.

Many of these issues stem from and/or contribute to an outrageous turnover rate that continues to cripple the department.

review_title: Great students and hard-working faculty; some hazardous facilities and poor leadership
job_title: Assistant Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The students are a joy to work with. They are bright, kind and earnest. In my experience with the faculty, they are knowledgeable in their fields and generous.
cons: There is one very new building on campus, but the rest of the facilities are substandard, even to the point of tape holding together towel dispensers. The salaries are woefully low and the faculty are harnessed with an extraordinary amount of overload, sometimes teaching as many as 6 and 7 classes a semester because the Deans refuse to hire the appropriate amount of faculty members. The people in power don't seen to care that the faculty members are overextended and the University seems more interested in wringing every bit from both the students and faculty in a business model rather than focusing on providing an actual educational experience.

review_title: Great place to work for adjuncts!
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Small, private university with overall very motivated students!  This university really invests money in providing valuable training opportunities to adjuncts.  I am included in many decisions and my opinion is solicited regarding student and course planning issues.  At other institutions at which I have taught, adjuncts are all but ignored and not included in events or decisions that impact the department.  I feel VERY valued and respected here!  Any and all needs I have, whether it be office space, materials, software, computer equipment, etc. are met in a timely manner.  Wonderful place to work!
cons: Very few full-time positions available.

review_title: Great students but terrible work environment
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The students were amazing and professional.  Best students I have ever worked with when I was there.
cons: The faculty is toxic and greedy for power.  It consists of male domination making females feel superior.  They keep admitting huge amounts of students into programs that can't possibly sustain the growth without hiring adequate faculty to teach them.  Also, huge hiring turnover.  People leave after a few years due to toxic environment and overloaded classes.  Some of the faculty teaches seven to eight classes a semester.  It's unheard of at other Universities.

review_title: High tolerance for things that need fixing but in the end this place exhausted me.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Had a good deal of autonomy to grow a program.
cons: Had to deal with massive inefficiencies and lack of cohesive coordination across affected departments.  Serious budget issues are facing the entire institution while they continue to take on debt.

job_title: in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Wonderful and brilliant colleagues throughout the faculty. Most everyone is creative in their field and easy to work with.  Very friendly and down-to-earth personalities.
cons: The pay is simply too low.  As an adjust instructor, they start you out at $31 per hour, which is less than what a college student would demand for an hour of instruction.

job_title: Specialist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: This is a great university with a lot of heart and love of their students. Middle-management is great and I work in a department that is very team oriented. We are praised for our innovation and creativity in solving problems.
cons: The financial climate of the university is fragile and they need to implement major changes in leadership and financial goals if they wish to succeed in the already risky higher education field.

review_title: Not a Place to Spend a Career
job_title: Associate Professor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great students, you get to learn a lot about how universities work.
cons: No raises; tenure protections are not what you would expect; very volatile leadership.

job_title: in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Free tuition. Students are fun to work with.
cons: The pay is extremely low hours are long some leadership is cliquish and shows unfair partiailiy to who they hired. Lots of micro management.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I work in campus tech at OCU. They offer good training for new staff. The environment is good.
cons: Salary is just normal, but you should understand it is university.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Friendly, safe place to work . Tuition remission good. Benefits okay.  Time off good.
cons: No raises or chance for  advancement.

job_title: Technology Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: free to do whatever you want
cons: just basic salary, i guess this is just the part time job so they only pay the basic salary

job_title: Director in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great benefits like summer Fridays.
cons: If you don't have a JD, then you won't be looked at with respect.

job_title: Workstudy in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Decent job for a student - can potentially qualify for a tuition waiver
cons: Politics, lots of it, did i say lots?

job_title: Computer Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Pressure Free atmosphere feels great to work with my supervisor

job_title: Director in Oklahoma City, OK

job_title: Director in Oklahoma City, OK
